register.description: Peripheral identification register

bitfield.description: Scheme. Distinguishes between old scheme and current.
MCASP. Indicates a software-compatible module family.
RTL version.
Major revision number.
Non-custom. Indicates a special version for a given device.
Minor revision number.

register.description: Power idle module configuration register.

bitfield.description: Reserved for future expansion
0x0: Force-idle mode 0x1: No-idle mode 0x2: Smart-idle mode - default state 0x3: Reserved

register.description: Specifies the function of the pins as either a MCASP pin or a GPIO pin

bitfield.description: Determines if AFSR pin (device level: mcaspi_fsr signal) functions as MCASP or GPIO.
Determines if ACLKR pin (device level: mcaspi_aclkr signal) functions as MCASP or GPIO.

register.description: Pin direction register - specifies the direction of the MCASP pins as either an input or an output pin.

bitfield.description: Determines if AFSR pin (device level: mcaspi_fsr signal) functions as an input or output.
Determines if ACLKR pin (device level: mcaspi_aclkr signal) functions as an input or output.

register.description: Pin data output register - holds a value for data out at all times, and may be read back at all times. The value held by is not affected by writing to and . However, the data value in is driven out onto the MCASP pin only if the corresponding bit in is set to 1 (GPIO function) and the corresponding bit in is set to 1 (output).

bitfield.description: Determines drive on AFSR output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[31] and MCASP_PDIR[31] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AHCLKR output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[30] and MCASP_PDIR[30] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on ACLKR output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[29] and MCASP_PDIR[29] bits are set to 1
Determines drive on AFSX output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[28] and MCASP_PDIR[28] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AHCLKX output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[27] and MCASP_PDIR[27] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on ACLKX output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[26] and MCASP_PDIR[26] bits are set to 1
Determines drive on AXR15 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[15] and MCASP_PDIR[15] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR14 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[14] and MCASP_PDIR[14] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR13 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[13] and MCASP_PDIR[13] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR12 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[12] and MCASP_PDIR[12] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR11 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[11] and MCASP_PDIR[11] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR10 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[10] and MCASP_PDIR[10] bits are set to 1.

Determines drive on AXR6 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[6] and MCASP_PDIR[6] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR5 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[5] and MCASP_PDIR[5] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR4 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[4] and MCASP_PDIR[4] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR3 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[3] and MCASP_PDIR[3] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR2 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[2] and MCASP_PDIR[2] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR1 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[1] and MCASP_PDIR[1] bits are set to 1.
Determines drive on AXR0 output pin when the correspondingMCASP_PFUNC[0] and MCASP_PDIR[0] bits are set to 1.

register.description: Pin data input register - holds the state of all the MCASP pins. allows reading the actual value of the pin, regardless of the state of and .

bitfield.description: Logic level on AFSR pin (device level: mcaspi_fsr signal).
Logic level on ACLKR pin (device level: mcaspi_aclkr signal).

register.description: The pin data set register is an alias of the pin data output register () for writes only. Writing a 1 to the bit sets the corresponding bit in and, if = 1 (GPIO function) and = 1 (output), drives a logic high on the pin.

bitfield.description: Allows the corresponding AFSR bit inMCASP_PDOUT to be set to a logic high without affecting other I/O pins controlled by the same port.
Allows the corresponding ACLKR bit inMCASP_PDOUT to be set to a logic high without affecting other I/O pins controlled by the same port.

register.description: The pin data clear register is an alias of the pin data output register () for writes only. Writing a 1 to the bit clears the corresponding bit in and, if = 1 (GPIO function) and = 1 (output), drives a logic low on the pin.

bitfield.description: Allows the corresponding AFSR bit inMCASP_PDOUT to be cleared to a logic low without affecting other I/O pins controlled by the same port.
Allows the corresponding ACLKR bit inMCASP_PDOUT to be cleared to a logic low without affecting other I/O pins controlled by the same port.

register.description: Global transmit control register - provides initialization of the transmit and receive sections. The bit fields in are synchronized and latched by the transmitter and receiver corresponding clocks - mcaspi_aclkx clock ( bits [12:8] ) and mcaspi_aclkr ( bits [4:0] ), respectively. Before programming , ensure that the serial clocks are running. If the corresponding external serial clocks - mcaspi_aclkx and mcaspi_aclkr, are not yet running, select the internal serial clock source in AHCLKXCTL, AHCLKRCTL, ACLKXCTL and ACLKRCTL before programming the . Also, after programming any bits in , do not proceed until reading back from and verifying that the bits in are latched.

bitfield.description: Transmit frame-sync generator reset enable bit

bitenum.description: The transmit frame-sync generator is reset.
The transmit frame-sync generator is active. When released from reset, the transmit frame-sync generator begins counting serial clocks and generating frame sync as programmed.

bitfield.description: Transmit state-machine reset enable bitAXR[n] pin state : If[n] = 0 and [n] = 1, the corresponding serializer [n] drives the AXR[n] pin to the state specified for inactive time slot. .

bitenum.description: The transmit state-machine is held in reset.

The transmit state-machine is released from reset. When released from reset, the transmit state-machine immediately transfers data from XBUF[n] to XRSR[n]. The transmit state-machine sets the underrun flag (XUNDRN) in MCASP_XSTAT, if XBUF[n] have not been preloaded with data before reset is released. The transmit state-machine also immediately begins detecting frame sync and is ready to transmit. Transmission of TDM time slot begins at slot 0 after reset is released.

bitfield.description: Transmit serializer clear enable bit. By clearing and then setting this bit, the transmit buffer is flushed to an empty state (XDATA = 1). If XSMRST = 1, XSRCLR = 1, XDATA = 1, and XBUF is not loaded with new data before the start of the next active time slot, an underrun occurs.

bitenum.description: The transmit serializer is active. When the transmit serializer is first taken out of reset (XSRCLR changes from 0 to 1), the transmit data ready bit (XDATA) in MCASP_XSTAT is set to indicate XBUF is ready to be written.

bitfield.description: Transmit high-frequency clock divider reset enable bit

bitenum.description: The transmitter high-frequency clock divider is held in reset and passes through its input as divide-by-1.
The transmitter high-frequency clock divider is running.

bitfield.description: Transmit clock divider reset enable bit

bitenum.description: The transmit clock divider is held in reset. When the clock divider is in reset, it passes through a divide-by-1 of its input.
The transmit clock divider is running.

bitfield.description: Receive frame sync generator reset enable bit.

bitenum.description: Receive frame sync generator is reset.
Receive frame sync generator is active. When released from reset, the receive frame sync generator begins counting serial clocks and generating frame sync as programmed.

bitfield.description: Receive state machine reset enable bit.

bitenum.description: Receive state machine is held in reset.

Receive state machine is released from reset. When released from reset, the receive state machine immediately begins detecting frame sync and is ready to receive. Receive TDM time slot begins at slot 0 after reset is released.

bitfield.description: Receive serializer clear enable bit. By clearing then setting this bit, the receive buffer is flushed.
Receive high-frequency clock divider reset enable bit.

bitenum.description: Receive high-frequency clock divider is held in reset and passes through its input as divide-by-1.
Receive high-frequency clock divider is running.

bitfield.description: Receive clock divider reset enable bit.

bitenum.description: Receive clock divider is held in reset. When the clock divider is in reset, it passes through a divide-by-1 of its input.

register.description: Mute control register - Controls the MCASP mute output pin - AMUTE (device level - not implemented)

The digital loopback control register () controls the internal (MCASP module)- level and chip-level loopback settings of the MCASP in TDM mode. Note that loopback is NOT supported if MCASP is configured in DIT mode.

bitfield.description: If DLBEN=0b1, the IOLBEN bit selects between and loopback modes. IOLBEN bit value is irrelevant, If DLBEN=0b0.

bitenum.description: MCASP internal loopback mode enabled. This selects a direct loopback between corresponding MCASP AXRn and AXRn+1 pins, bypassing device pad I/O buffers.
Chip I/O-level loopback mode enabled. The MCASP data is looped back through the device pad I/O buffers.

bitfield.description: Loopback generator mode bits.0x2, 0x3: Reserved enum=RESERVED .

bitenum.description: MODE must be set to 0x1 when MCASP operates in loopback mode (DLBEN =0b1). This is necessary to allow transmit clock and frame sync generators to be used by both transmit and receive sections.

bitfield.description: Loopback order bit when loopback mode is enabled (DLBEN = 1).

bitenum.description: Odd serializers N + 1 transmit to even serializers N that receive. The corresponding serializers must be programmed properly.
Even serializers N transmit to odd serializers N+1 that receive. The corresponding serializers must be programmed properly.

bitfield.description: Loop back mode enable bit.

bitenum.description: Loop back mode is disabled (normal MCASP operation).
Loop back is enabled (TDM mode only). Loopback type is selected in IOLBEN bit.

register.description: Transmit DIT mode control register, controls DIT operations of the MCASP

bitfield.description: Valid bit for odd time slots (DIT right subframe).

bitenum.description: V bit is 0 during odd DIT subframes.
V bit is 1 during odd DIT subframes.

bitfield.description: Valid bit for even time slots (DIT left subframe).

bitenum.description: V bit is 0 during even DIT subframes.
V bit is 1 during even DIT subframes.

bitfield.description: DIT mode enable bit

bitenum.description: DIT mode is enabled. Transmitter operates in DIT encoded mode.

register.description: Alias of GBLCTL. When writing to this register, only the TRANSMIT bits of GBLCTL are affected (This means GBLCTL bits 8,9,10,11,12). Reads return GBLCTL

bitfield.description: Frame sync generator reset
XMT state machine reset
XMT serializer clear
XMT High Freq. clk Divider
XMT clock divder reset
Frame sync generator reset
RCV state machine reset
RCV serializer clear
RCV High Freq. clk Divider
RCV clock divder reset

register.description: The receive format unit bit mask register () determines which bits of the received data are masked off and padded with a known value before being read by the CPU.

bitfield.description: Receive data mask enable bit.

bitenum.description: Corresponding bit of receive data (after passing through reverse and rotate units) is masked out and then padded with the selected bit pad value (RPAD and RPBIT bits in RFMT).
Corresponding bit of receive data (after passing through reverse and rotate units) is returned to CPU or DMA.

register.description: The receive bit stream format register () configures the receive data format.

bitfield.description: Receive Frame sync delay of AXR[n]

bitenum.description: 0-bit delay. The first receive data bit, AXR[n], occurs in same ACLKR cycle as the receive frame sync (AFSR).
1-bit delay. The first receive data bit, AXR[n], occurs one ACLKR cycle after the receive frame sync (AFSR).
2-bit delay. The first receive data bit, AXR[n], occurs two ACLKR cycles after the receive frame sync (AFSR).

bitfield.description: Receive serial bitstream order

bitenum.description: Bitstream is LSB first. No bit reversal is performed in receive format bit reverse unit.
Bitstream is MSB first. Bit reversal is performed in receive format bit reverse unit.

bitfield.description: Pad value for extra bits in slot not belonging to the word. This field only applies to bits when RMASK[n] = 0.

bitenum.description: Pad extra bits with one of the bits from the word as specified by RPBIT bits.

bitfield.description: RPBIT value determines which bit (as read by the CPU from RBUF[n]) is used to pad the extra bits. This field only applies when RPAD = 2h.0x01 - 0x1F: Pad with value of the bit positioned within the range RBUFn[31:1]. .

bitenum.description: Pad with value of bit RBUFn[0].

bitfield.description: Receive slot size.0x0 - 0x2 : Reserved enum=RSVD .
Selects whether reads from serializer buffer RBUF[n] originate from the peripheral configuration CFG port or the DATA port.

bitenum.description: Reads from XRBUF[n] originate on DATA port. Reads from XRBUF[n] on the peripheral configuration port are ignored.
Reads from XRBUF[n] originate on peripheral configuration port. Reads from XRBUF[n] on the DATA port are ignored.

bitfield.description: Right-rotation value for receive rotate right format unit.

register.description: The receive frame sync control register () configures the receive frame sync (AFSR).

bitfield.description: Receive frame sync mode select bits.0x3 - 0x20: 3-slot TDM to 32-slot TDM mode . 0x21 - 0x17F: Reserved . 0x181 - 0x1FF: Reserved .

bitenum.description: 384-slot TDM (external DIR IC inputting 384-slot DIR frames to MCASP)

bitfield.description: Receive frame sync width select bit indicates the width of the receive frame sync (AFSR) during its active period.

bitenum.description: Single word. Single word is not supported if RMOD is set to burst mode.

bitfield.description: Receive frame sync generation select bit.
Receive frame sync polarity select bit.

bitenum.description: A rising edge on receive frame sync (AFSR) indicates the beginning of a frame.
A falling edge on receive frame sync (AFSR) indicates the beginning of a frame.

register.description: The receive clock control register () configures the receive bit clock (ACLKR) and the receive clock generator.

bitfield.description: Status: logical OR of DIVBUSY, ADJBUSY. Not supported.
Status: divide ratio change in progress? Not supported.
Status: one-shot adjustment in progress? Not supported.

CLKRDIV one-shot adjustment. Not supported. Bit field must always be written as 0x0.If CLKRDIV is set such that there are “m” input clocks per one output clock, then for one output cycle:00 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . 01 = (m-1) input clocks per output clock . 10 = (m+1) input clocks per output clock . 11 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . NOTE: writes to these bits are ineffective if CLKADJEN:ENABLE bit is set to 0b. These bits are ALWAYS read back as zero. .
Receive bitstream clock polarity select bit. Note that this bitfield does not have any effect, ifMCASP_ACLKXCTL[6] ASYNC = 0

bitenum.description: Falling edge. Receiver samples data on the falling edge of the serial clock, so the external transmitter driving this receiver must shift data out on the rising edge of the serial clock.
Rising edge. Receiver samples data on the rising edge of the serial clock, so the external transmitter driving this receiver must shift data out on the falling edge of the serial clock.

bitfield.description: Receive bit clock source bit. Note that this bitfield does not have any effect, ifMCASP_ACLKXCTL[6] ASYNC = 0

bitenum.description: External receive clock source from ACLKR pin.
Internal receive clock source from output of programmable bit clock divider.

bitfield.description: Receive bit clock divide ratio bits determine the divide-down ratio from AHCLKR to ACLKR. Note that this bitfield does not have any effect, ifMCASP_ACLKXCTL[6] ASYNC = 0.0x2 - 0x1F: Divide-by-3 to divide-by-32 .

register.description: The receive high-frequency clock control register () configures the receive high-frequency master clock (AHCLKR) and the receive clock generator.

bitfield.description: Status: logical OR of DIVBUSY, ADJBUSY. Not supported.
Status: divide ratio change in progress? Not supported.
Status: one-shot adjustment in progress? Not supported.

HCLKRDIV one-shot adjustment. Not supported. Bit field must always be written as 0x0. If HCLKRDIV is set such that there are “m” input clocks per one output clock, then for one output cycle:00 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . 01 = (m-1) input clocks per output clock . 10 = (m+1) input clocks per output clock . 11 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . NOTE: writes to these bits are ineffective if CLKADJEN:ENABLE bit is set to 0b. These bits are ALWAYS read back as zero. .
High Freq. RCV clock Source
Receive bitstream high-frequency clock polarity select bit.

bitenum.description: Not inverted. AHCLKR is not inverted before programmable bit clock divider.
Inverted. AHCLKR is inverted before programmable bit clock divider.

bitfield.description: Receive high-frequency clock divide ratio bits determine the divide-down ratio from AUXCLK to AHCLKR.0x2 - 0xFFF: Divide-by-3 to divide-by-4096 .

register.description: The receive TDM time slot register () specifies which TDM time slot the receiver is active.

bitfield.description: Receiver mode during TDM time slot n.

bitenum.description: Receive TDM time slot n is inactive. The receive serializer does not shift in data during this slot.
Receive TDM time slot n is active. The receive serializer shifts in data during this slot.

register.description: Receiver Interrupt control register - controls generation of the MCASP receive interrupt (RINT). When the register bit(s) is set to 1, the occurrence of the enabled MCASP condition(s) generates RINT.

bitfield.description: Receive start of frame interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A receive-start-of-frame interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A receive-start-of-frame interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

bitfield.description: Receive data-ready interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A receive data-ready interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A receive data-ready interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

bitfield.description: Receive last slot interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A receive-last-slot interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A receive-last-slot interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

bitfield.description: Receive DMA error interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A receive DMA error interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A receive DMA error interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

bitfield.description: Receive clock failure interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A receive clock failure interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A receive clock failure interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

bitfield.description: Unexpected receive frame-sync interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. An unexpected receive frame-sync interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. An unexpected receive frame-sync interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

bitfield.description: Receiver overrun interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A receiver overrun interrupt does not generate a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A receiver overrun interrupt generates a MCASP receive interrupt (RINT).

register.description: The receiver status register () provides the receiver status and receive TDM time slot number.

bitfield.description: RERR bit always returns a logic-OR of: ROVRN | RSYNCERR | RCKFAIL | RDMAERR Allows a single bit to be checked to determine if a receiver error has occurred.

Receive DMA error flag. RDMAERR is set when the CPU or DMA reads more serializers through the DMA port in a given time slot than were programmed as receivers. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

bitenum.description: Receive DMA error did not occur.

bitfield.description: Receive start of frame flag. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

bitenum.description: No new receive frame sync (AFSR) is detected.
A new receive frame sync (AFSR) is detected.

bitfield.description: Receive data ready flag. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

bitenum.description: Data is transferred from XRSR to RBUF and ready to be serviced by the CPUs or DMA.When RDATA is set, it always causes a DMA event (AREVT).

bitfield.description: Receive last slot flag. RLAST is set along with RDATA, if the current slot is the last slot in a frame. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

bitenum.description: Current slot is not the last slot in a frame.
Current slot is the last slot in a frame. RDATA is also set.

bitfield.description: Returns the LSB of RSLOT. Allows a single read ofMCASP_RXSTAT to determine whether the current TDM time slot is even or odd.

bitenum.description: Current TDM time slot is odd.
Current TDM time slot is even.

bitfield.description: Receive clock failure flag. RCKFAIL is set when the receive clock failure detection circuit reports an error. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

bitenum.description: Receive clock failure did not occur.

bitfield.description: Unexpected receive frame sync flag. RSYNCERR is set when a new receive frame sync (AFSR) occurs before it is expected. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

bitenum.description: Unexpected receive frame sync did not occur.
Unexpected receive frame sync did occur.

bitfield.description: Receiver overrun flag. ROVRN is set when the receive serializer is instructed to transfer data from XRSR to RBUF, but the former data in RBUF has not yet been read by the CPU or DMA. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect.

register.description: The current receive TDM time slot register () indicates the current time slot for the receive data frame.

bitfield.description: 0x0 - 0x17F: Current receive time slot count. Legal values: 0 to 383 (17Fh). TDM function is not supported for &gt; 32 time slots. However, TDM time slot counter may count to 383 when used to receive a DIR block (transferred over TDM format).

register.description: The receive clock check control register (RCLKCHK) configures the receive clock failure detection circuit.

bitfield.description: 0x0 - 0xFF: Receive clock count value (from previous measurement). The clock circuit continually counts the number of interface clocks for every 32 receive high-frequency master clock (AHCLKR) signals, and stores the count in RCNT until the next measurement is taken.

0x00-0xFF: Receive clock maximum boundary. This 8-bit unsigned value sets the maximum allowed boundary for the clock check counter after 32 receive high-frequency master clock (AHCLKR) signals have been received. If the current counter value is greater than RMAX after counting 32 AHCLKR signals, RCKFAIL inMCASP_RXSTAT is set. The comparison is performed using unsigned arithmetic.

0x00 - 0xFF: Receive clock minimum boundary. This 8-bit unsigned value sets the minimum allowed boundary for the clock check counter after 32 receive high-frequency master clock (AHCLKR) signals have been received. If RCNT is less than RMIN after counting 32 AHCLKR signals, RCKFAIL in RSTAT is set. The comparison is performed using unsigned arithmetic.
Receive clock check prescaler value.0x9 - 0xF: Reserved enum=DIVBY8 .

register.description: Receiver DMA event control register

bitfield.description: Receive data DMA request enable bit.

bitenum.description: The receive data DMA request is enabled.
The receive data DMA request is disabled.

register.description: Alias of GBLCTL. When writing to this register, only the TRANSMIT bits of GBLCTL are affected (This means GBLCTL bits 8,9,10,11,12.). Reads return GBLCTL.

bitfield.description: Frame sync generator reset
XMT state machine reset
XMT serializer clear
XMT High Freq. clk Divider
XMT clock divder reset
Frame sync generator reset
RCV state machine reset
RCV serializer clear
RCV High Freq. clk Divider
RCV clock divder reset

register.description: Transmit format unit bit mask register - Determines which bits of the transmitted data are masked off before being shifted out the MCASP

bitfield.description: Transmit data mask enable bit

bitenum.description: The corresponding bit of transmit data is masked out and then transmitted out the MCASP in place of the original bit.
The corresponding bit of transmit data is transmitted out the MCASP.

register.description: Transmit bitstream format register - configures the transmit data format

bitfield.description: Transmit sync bit delay

bitenum.description: 0 bit delay - The first transmit data bit, on the AXR[n], occurs in the same mcaspi_aclkx cycle as the transmit frame sync (mcaspi_fsx).
1-bit delay. The first transmit data bit, AXR[n], occurs one ACLKX cycle after the transmit frame sync (AFSX).
2-bit delay. The first transmit data bit, AXR[n], occurs two ACLKX cycles after the transmit frame sync (AFSX).

bitfield.description: Transmit serial bitstream order

bitenum.description: Bitstream is LSB first. No bit reversal is performed in transmit format unit.
Bitstream is MSB first. Bit reversal is performed in transmit format bit reverse unit.

bitfield.description: Pad value for extra bits in slot not belonging to word defined by XMASK. This field only applies to bits when XMASK[n] = 0.

bitenum.description: Pad extra bits with one of the bits from the word as specified by XPBIT bits.

bitfield.description: XPBIT value determines which bit (as written by the CPU or DMA to XBUF[n]) is used to pad the extra bits before shifting. This field only applies when XPAD = 0x2.
Transmit slot size0x0 - 0x2 : Reserved enum=RSV8 .
Selects whether writes to the serializer buffer XBUF[n] originate from the peripheral configuration CFG port or the DATA port.

bitenum.description: Writes to XBUF[n] originate from the DATA port. Writes to XBUF[n] from the peripheral configuration port are ignored with no effect on the MCASP.
Writes to XBUF[n] originate from the peripheral configuration port - CFG port. Writes to XBUF[n] from the DATA port are ignored with no effect on the MCASP.

bitfield.description: Right-rotation value for transmit rotate right format unit

register.description: Transmit frame-sync control register - configures the transmit frame sync (mcaspi_fsx).

bitfield.description: Transmit frame-sync mode select bits 0x0: Burst mode 0x1: Reserved 0x2: 2-slot TDM mode () 0x3 - 0x20: 3-slot TDM to 32-slot TDM mode 0x21 - 0x17F: Reserved 0x180: 384-slot DIT mode All other: Reserved
The transmit frame-sync width select bit indicates the width of the transmit frame sync (mcaspi_fsx) during its active period.

bitenum.description: Single word. Single word is not supported if XMOD is set to burst mode.

bitfield.description: Transmit frame-sync generation select bit
Transmit frame-sync polarity select bit

bitenum.description: Rising Edge - A rising edge on transmit frame sync (mcaspi_fsx) indicates the beginning of a frame.
Falling Edge - A falling edge on transmit frame sync (mcaspi_fsx) indicates the beginning of a frame.

register.description: Transmit clock control register - Configures the transmit bit clock (mcaspi_aclkx) and the transmit clock generator.

bitfield.description: Status: logical OR of DIVBUSY, ADJBUSY. Not supported.
Status: divide ratio change in progress? Not supported.
Status: one-shot adjustment in progress? Not supported.

CLKXDIV one-shot adjustment. Not supported. Bit field must always be written as 0x0. If CLKXDIV is set such that there are “m” input clocks per one output clock, then for one output cycle:00 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . 01 = (m-1) input clocks per output clock . 10 = (m+1) input clocks per output clock . 11 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . NOTE: writes to these bits are ineffective if CLKADJEN:ENABLE bit is set to 0b. These bits are ALWAYS read back as zero. .
Transmit bitstream clock polarity select bit.

bitenum.description: Rising edge. External receiver samples data on the falling edge of the serial clock, so the transmitter must shift data out on the rising edge of the serial clock.
Falling edge. External receiver samples data on the rising edge of the serial clock, so the transmitter must shift data out on the falling edge of the serial clock.

bitfield.description: Transmit operation asynchronous enable bit

bitenum.description: Synchronous. Transmit clock and frame sync provides the source for both the transmit and receive sections. Note that in this mode, the receive bit clock is an inverted version of the transmit bit clock.
Asynchronous. Separate clock and frame sync used by transmit and receive sections.

bitfield.description: Transmit bit clock source bit

bitenum.description: External transmit clock source from ACLKX pin.

bitfield.description: Transmit bit clock divide ratio bits, determine the divide-down ratio from AHCLKX to ACLKX. 0x0: Divide-by-1 0x1: Divide-by-2 0x2 to 0x1F: Divide-by-3 to divide-by-32

register.description: High-frequency transmit clock control register - Configures the transmit high-frequency master clock (mcaspi_ahclkx) and the transmit clock generator.

bitfield.description: Status: logical OR of DIVBUSY, ADJBUSY. Not supported.
Status: divide ratio change in progress? Not supported.
Status: one-shot adjustment in progress? Not supported.

HCLKXDIV one-shot adjustment. Not supported. Bit field must always be written as 0x0. If HCLKXDIV is set such that there are “m” input clocks per one output clock, then for one output cycle:00 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . 01 = (m-1) input clocks per output clock . 10 = (m+1) input clocks per output clock . 11 = (m+0) input clocks per output clock, i.e. no adjustment . NOTE: writes to these bits are ineffective if CLKADJEN:ENABLE bit is set to 0b. These bits are ALWAYS read back as zero. .
Transmit high-frequency clock source bit

bitenum.description: External transmit high-frequency clock source from AHCLKX pin.
Internal transmit high-frequency clock source from output of programmable high clock divider

bitfield.description: Transmit bitstream high-frequency clock polarity select bit.

bitenum.description: Not inverted. AHCLKX is not inverted before programmable bit clock divider.
Inverted. AHCLKX is inverted before programmable bit clock divider.

bitfield.description: Transmit high-frequency clock divide ratio bits determine the divide-down ratio from AUXCLK to mcaspi_ahclkx. 0x0: Divide-by-1 0x1: Divide-by-2 0x2 to 0xFFF: Divide-by-3 to divide-by-4096

register.description: Transmit TDM slot 0-31 register - TDM time slot counter range is to 384 slots (to support SPDIF blocks of 384 subframes).

bitfield.description: Transmitter mode during TDM time slot n (n = 0..31)

bitenum.description: Transmit TDM time slot n is inactive. The transmit serializer does not shift out data during this slot.
The transmit TDM time slot n is active. The transmit serializer shifts out data during this slot according to the serializer control registers -.

register.description: Transmitter Interrupt control register - controls generation of the MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT). When the register bit(s) is set to 1, the occurrence of the enabled MCASP condition(s) generates XINT.

bitfield.description: Transmit start of frame interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A transmit-start-of-frame interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A transmit-start-of-frame interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

bitfield.description: Transmit data-ready interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A transmit data-ready interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A transmit data-ready interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

bitfield.description: Transmit last slot interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A transmit-last-slot interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A transmit-last-slot interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

bitfield.description: Transmit DMA error interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A transmit DMA error interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A transmit DMA error interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

bitfield.description: Transmit clock failure interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A transmit clock failure interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A transmit clock failure interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

bitfield.description: Unexpected transmit frame-sync interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. An unexpected transmit frame-sync interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. An unexpected transmit frame-sync interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

bitfield.description: Transmitter underrun interrupt enable bit

bitenum.description: Interrupt is disabled. A transmitter underrun interrupt does not generate a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).
Interrupt is enabled. A transmitter underrun interrupt generates a MCASP transmit interrupt (XINT).

register.description: Transmitter status register - If the MCASP logic attempts to set an interrupt flag in the same cycle that the CPU writes to the flag to clear it, the MCASP logic has priority and the flag remains set. This also causes the generation of a new interrupt request.

bitfield.description: XERR bit always returns a logic-OR of: XUNDRN | XSYNCERR | XCKFAIL | XDMAERR. Allows a single bit to be checked to determine if a transmitter error interrupt has occurred.

Transmit DMA error flag. XDMAERR is set when the CPU or DMA writes more words to the DATA port of the MCASP in a given time slot than it should. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XDMAERR inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing a 0 has no effect.

bitenum.description: Transmit DMA error did not occur.

bitfield.description: Transmit start of frame flag. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XSTAFRM inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing a 0 has no effect.

bitenum.description: No new transmit frame sync (AFSX) is detected.
A new transmit frame sync (AFSX) is detected.

bitfield.description: Transmit data ready flag. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XDATA inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to iit. Writing a 0 has no effect

bitenum.description: XBUF[n] is written and is full

Data is copied from XBUF[n] to XRSR[n]. XBUF[n] is empty and ready to be written. XDATA is also set when the transmit serializers are taken out of reset. When XDATA is set, it always causes a DMA event (AXEVT).

bitfield.description: Transmit last slot flag. XLAST, along with XDATA, are set if the current slot is the last slot in a frame. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XLAST inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to iit. Writing a 0 has no effect.

bitenum.description: Current slot is not the last slot in a frame.
Current slot is the last slot in a frame. XDATA is also set.

bitfield.description: Returns the LSB of XSLOT. Allows a single read of XSTAT to determine whether the current TDM time slot is even or odd.

bitenum.description: Current TDM time slot is odd.
Current TDM time slot is even.

bitfield.description: Transmit clock failure flag. XCKFAIL is set when the transmit clock failure detection circuit reports an error. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XCKFAIL inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to iit. Writing a 0 has no effect.

bitenum.description: Transmit clock failure did not occur.

bitfield.description: Unexpected transmit frame-sync flag. XSYNCERR is set when a new transmit frame sync (AFSX) occurs before it is expected. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XSYNCERR inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to iit. Writing a 0 has no effect.

bitenum.description: Unexpected transmit frame sync did not occur

bitfield.description: Transmitter underrun flag. XUNDRN is set when the transmit serializer is instructed to transfer data from XBUF[n] to XRSR[n], but XBUF[n] has not yet been serviced with new data since the last transfer. Causes a transmit interrupt (XINT) if this bit and XUNDRN inMCASP_EVTCTLX are set. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to iit. Writing a 0 has no effect.

register.description: Current transmit TDM time slot register

bitfield.description: Current transmit time slot count. the value of this register is 0b0101111111 (0x17f) during reset and 0 after reset.

register.description: Transmit clock check control register - configures the transmit clock failure detection circuit.

bitfield.description: Transmit clock count value (from previous measurement). The clock circuit continually counts the number of interface clocks for every 32 transmit high-frequency master clock (mcaspi_ahclkx) signals, and stores the count in XCNT until the next measurement is taken

0x0 to 0xFF: Transmit clock maximum boundary. This 8-bit unsigned value sets the maximum allowed boundary for the clock check counter after 32 transmit high-frequency master clock (mcaspi_ahclkx) signals have been received. If the current counter value is greater than XMAX after counting 32 AHCLKX signals, XCKFAIL in XSTAT is set. The comparison is performed using unsigned arithmetic.

0x0 to 0xFF: Transmit clock minimum boundary. This 8-bit unsigned value sets the minimum allowed boundary for the clock check counter after 32 transmit high-frequency master clock (mcaspi_ahclkx) signals have been received. If XCNT is less than XMIN after counting 32 AHCLKX signals, XCKFAIL in XSTAT is set. The comparison is performed using unsigned arithmetic.

Transmit clock check prescaler value 0x0: MCASP interface clock divided by 1 0x1: MCASP interface clock divided by 2 0x2: MCASP interface clock divided by 4 0x3: MCASP interface clock divided by 8 0x4: MCASP interface clock divided by 16 0x5: MCASP interface clock divided by 32 0x6: MCASP interface clock divided by 64 0x7: MCASP interface clock divided by 128 0x8: MCASP interface clock divided by 256 0x9 to 0xF: Reserved

register.description: Transmitter DMA event control register

bitfield.description: Transmit data DMA request enable bit.

bitenum.description: The transmit data DMA request is enabled.
The transmit data DMA request is disabled.

register.description: One-Shot Clock Adjustment Enable

bitfield.description: One-shot clock adjust enable. Not supported. Bit field must always be written as 0x0.

register.description: DIT left channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT left channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) channel status

The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) channel status

The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) channel status

The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT right channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT right channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT right channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT right channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT right channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT right channel status register - All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of channel status data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register file before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) channel status

register.description: DIT left channel user data register - provides the user data of each left channel (even TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT left channel user data register - provides the user data of each left channel (even TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT left channel user data register - provides the user data of each left channel (even TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT left channel user data register - provides the user data of each left channel (even TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT left channel user data register - provides the user data of each left channel (even TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT left channel user data register - provides the user data of each left channel (even TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Left (even TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT right user data register - provides the user data of each right channel (odd TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT right user data register - provides the user data of each right channel (odd TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT right user data register - provides the user data of each right channel (odd TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT right user data register - provides the user data of each right channel (odd TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) user data

register.description: DIT right user data register - provides the user data of each right channel (odd TDM time slot). All six 32-bit registers (i = 0 to 5) can store 192 bits of user data for a complete block of transmission. The DIT reuses the same data for the next block. Make sure to update the register before a different set of data needs to be sent.

bitfield.description: Right (odd TDM slot ) user data

register.description: Serializer n control register.

bitfield.description: Receive buffer ready bit. RRDY indicates the current receive buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a transmitter or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to receive (2h), RRDY switches from 0 to 1 whenever data is transferred from XRSRn to RBUFn.

bitenum.description: Receive buffer () contains data and needs to be read before the start of the next time slot or a receiver overrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Transmit buffer ready bit. XRDY indicates the current transmit buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a receiver or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to transmit (1h), XRDY switches from 0 to 1 when XSRCLR in GBLCTL is switched from 0 to 1 to indicate an empty transmitter. XRDY remains set until XSRCLR is forced to 0, data is written to the corresponding transmit buffer, or SRMOD bit is changed to receive (2h) or inactive (0).

bitenum.description: The transmit buffer () is empty and needs to be written before the start of the next time slot or a transmit underrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Serializer pin drive mode bit. Drive on pin when in inactive TDM slot of transmit mode or when serializer is inactive. This field only applies if the pin is configured as a MCASP pin (PFUNC = 0).

bitenum.description: Drive on pin is logic low.
Drive on pin is logic high.

bitfield.description: Serializer mode bit

bitenum.description: The serializer is operating in transmit mode.
The serializer is operating in receive mode.

register.description: Serializer n control register.

bitfield.description: Receive buffer ready bit. RRDY indicates the current receive buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a transmitter or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to receive (2h), RRDY switches from 0 to 1 whenever data is transferred from XRSRn to RBUFn.

bitenum.description: Receive buffer () contains data and needs to be read before the start of the next time slot or a receiver overrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Transmit buffer ready bit. XRDY indicates the current transmit buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a receiver or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to transmit (1h), XRDY switches from 0 to 1 when XSRCLR in GBLCTL is switched from 0 to 1 to indicate an empty transmitter. XRDY remains set until XSRCLR is forced to 0, data is written to the corresponding transmit buffer, or SRMOD bit is changed to receive (2h) or inactive (0).

bitenum.description: The transmit buffer () is empty and needs to be written before the start of the next time slot or a transmit underrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Serializer pin drive mode bit. Drive on pin when in inactive TDM slot of transmit mode or when serializer is inactive. This field only applies if the pin is configured as a MCASP pin (PFUNC = 0).

bitenum.description: Drive on pin is logic low.
Drive on pin is logic high.

bitfield.description: Serializer mode bit

bitenum.description: The serializer is operating in transmit mode.
The serializer is operating in receive mode.

register.description: Serializer n control register.

bitfield.description: Receive buffer ready bit. RRDY indicates the current receive buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a transmitter or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to receive (2h), RRDY switches from 0 to 1 whenever data is transferred from XRSRn to RBUFn.

bitenum.description: Receive buffer () contains data and needs to be read before the start of the next time slot or a receiver overrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Transmit buffer ready bit. XRDY indicates the current transmit buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a receiver or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to transmit (1h), XRDY switches from 0 to 1 when XSRCLR in GBLCTL is switched from 0 to 1 to indicate an empty transmitter. XRDY remains set until XSRCLR is forced to 0, data is written to the corresponding transmit buffer, or SRMOD bit is changed to receive (2h) or inactive (0).

bitenum.description: Drive on pin is logic low.
Drive on pin is logic high.

The serializer is operating in receive mode.

bitfield.description: Receive buffer ready bit. RRDY indicates the current receive buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a transmitter or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to receive (2h), RRDY switches from 0 to 1 whenever data is transferred from XRSRn to RBUFn.

bitenum.description: Receive buffer () contains data and needs to be read before the start of the next time slot or a receiver overrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Transmit buffer ready bit. XRDY indicates the current transmit buffer state. Always reads 0 when programmed as a receiver or as inactive. If SRMOD bit is set to transmit (1h), XRDY switches from 0 to 1 when XSRCLR in GBLCTL is switched from 0 to 1 to indicate an empty transmitter. XRDY remains set until XSRCLR is forced to 0, data is written to the corresponding transmit buffer, or SRMOD bit is changed to receive (2h) or inactive (0).

bitenum.description: The transmit buffer () is empty and needs to be written before the start of the next time slot or a transmit underrun occurs.

bitfield.description: Serializer pin drive mode bit. Drive on pin when in inactive TDM slot of transmit mode or when serializer is inactive. This field only applies if the pin is configured as a MCASP pin (PFUNC = 0).

bitenum.description: Drive on pin is logic low.
Drive on pin is logic high.

register.description: Transmit buffer n - The transmit buffer for the serializer n holds data from the transmit format unit.
